comments:
If you create a new Visual Class in a Project that is under CVS control (it doesn't happen for projects not in control), you get a Java Null Pointer Exception from the Visual Editor. It happens in Eclipse 3.1.1 and Eclips 3.2 even though the classes where the exception arises are different.
I append the logs for bot 3.1.1 and 3.2:
#################################################################
Eclipse 3.1.1:
#################################################################

What version of VE are you using?

Eclipse 3.1.1 can only support VE 1.1.0.1 and Eclipse 3.2 can only use the 1.2M1 build. They can't be interchanged.
Do you have any more info on this? Are you mixing the two or does this occur in both cases when using the correct versions of VE with the cooresponding Eclipse?
Haven't received any further info, so closing for now.
